n’t do it solely in virtue of the fact that your machine ran a certain kind of
computer program. The thinking machine couldn’t work solely in virtue
of  being  a  digital  computer  but  would  have  to  duplicate  the  specific
causal powers of the brain.
A lot  of  the  nonsense  talked  about  computers  nowadays  stems  from
their relative rarity and hence mystery. As computers and robots become
